title: Why pytorch run super slow on windows server 2012?
body_html:
Here is my question

I have a PC runs windows server 2012 R2 system with NVIDIA 1080ti,
and I have all drivers installed.
CUDA 9.0
cudnn 7.3
anaconda python3.6

Now I followed the pytorch.org instructions to install pytorch

conda install pytorch -c pytorch
pip install torchvision

and installed pytorch successfully!

However, when i run deep learning codes , for example YOLO3, it runs rather slow !
YOLO3 code should be able to detect an image within 40ms.
Now on windows server 2012, it runs more than 120ms per image which is three times slower than expected.

I also tried the same code on ubuntu16.04, and it runs within 40ms per image.

Do any other encounted the same problem?
Maybe windows server 2012 not compatible for pytorch?
Please somebody help me out! thanks!!!

body:
## Here is my question
I have a PC runs **windows server 2012 R2** system with **NVIDIA 1080ti**,
and I have all drivers installed.
CUDA 9.0
cudnn 7.3
anaconda python3.6

Now I followed the pytorch.org instructions to install pytorch
```bash
conda install pytorch -c pytorch
pip install torchvision
```
and installed pytorch successfully!

However, when i run deep learning codes , for example YOLO3, it runs rather slow !
YOLO3 code should be able to detect an image within 40ms.
**Now on windows server 2012, it runs more than 120ms per image which is three times slower than expected**.

**I also tried the same code on ubuntu16.04, and it runs within 40ms per image**.

Do any other encounted the same problem?
Maybe windows server 2012 not compatible for pytorch?
Please somebody help me out! thanks!!!
